result.execSummary:
The defendant Manuel M Salgado was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Operating While Suspended (Cause Great Bodily Harm), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
6/25/19 Probation is extended for 1 yr from 6/13/19 to 6/13/20, or until all court obligations are completed, whichever comes first.
7/8/19 Crt amends JOC to reflect probation date of extension is nunc pro tunc back to 5/14/19.
6/9/2020 Probation is extended for 1 yr from 6/13/2020 to 6/13/2021, or until all court obligations are completed, whichever comes first.
6/10/21 Probation is extended for 1 yr from 6/13/21 to 6/13/22, or until all court obligations are completed, whichever comes first. Def's probation may terminate before June 13, 2022 upon making $2400 in restitution payments after the signing of this order.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.  To be collected by the Department of Corrections.

Costs remitted. $92 VW surcharge to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.  $250 DNA surcharge remitted.
Do not drive a motor vehicle without valid DL and approval of agent and insurance.

Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.

Order Judgement For Court Ordered Financial Obligations

Probation is extended for 1 yr from 6/13/21 to 6/13/22, or until all court obligations are completed, whichever comes first. Def's probation may terminate before June 13, 2022 upon making $2400 in restitution payments after the signing of this order.   Amended Judgment of Conviction prepared.

Judge Chris Taylor appeared in person/video. Court reporter Phil Harrelson and clerk Casee Trickel appeared in person.
09:55 AM Defendant Manuel M Salgado appeared by video means. Probation agent Emily S appeared by video means. Attorney Lillian Nelson for Hector Al-Homsi appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin. Vic/wit Jeanne H appeared by video. Victims appeared by video. CT addresses restitution. Agent not requesting extension. Statement by Defn. Victims make statement. State requests extension of probation, argument by State. CT extends probation for 1 yr from 6/13-21 to 6/13/22. Probation may terminate after $2400 is paid towards restitution and civil judgment then entered.

Defendant appeared.  Shaun W O'Connell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
